Message.Title: Some weakness in stock price during the days ahead
Message.Msg: 1. Company internals...the stock hit and exceeded composite analyst projections therefore lower ratings are to be expected. In analysts jargon, this would fall into the "HOLD" category with the exception of Cramer who has a buy rating at even elevated stock price. 2. The external environment is getting worse by the day, therefore the stock price is likely to undergo some minor correction. 3. We are likely to revisit the $35.00 mark but not below. Disclosure- I am long the AT&T stock.

Message.Msg: Economists think this will slow GDP growth by at least 0.5% this year. Moody's estimates that the payroll tax increase will reduce GDP growth by 0.6% this year. You may think this is reason to celebrate, but I do not. By contrast, the increase in marginal rates on the wealthy is not expected to impact the economy. Neither would the long-term reduction in entitlements proposed by Obama. Your "solutions" gut the economy and gut the middle class. This is not a formula for long-term deficit reduction. It seems to me you Tea Brains are still trying to make Obama a one-term president by dragging down the economy. It didn't work in 2012. I imagine I will be collecting my gift in 2014.

Topic.Title: Will the American people care when they find out the truth about sequestration?

Message.Msg: No. The cuts are 2.3% of this year's Federal budget. The cuts are directed at discretionary spending. The bulk of the budget--payments from Medicare, Social Security & interest on the debt--are excluded from the cuts. That means the 2.3% cuts will go directly to the activities of government--the FAA, border patrol, head start, civilian defense workers. Year over year discretionary spending is down, even as the overall spending is up due to Medicare, Social Security, and interest on the debt. So their effect on Federal jobs and work hours is much higher than the 2.3% suggests. The Bipartisan Policy Center estimates that the sequester will result in 1 million fewer jobs in 2013 than otherwise--plus the furloughs, reduction in work hours, etc. These aren't all Federal jobs, as the effects of lower pay and fewer workers will ripple through the economy. Many economists consider these estimates baseline estimates. The results could be worse if the cuts lead to service problems as well, which is likely. These policies--the payroll tax increase, the sequester and the continued fiscal uncertainty--are insane in the middle of a lackluster, jobless recovery. Whoever you think is responsible for them, it is insane policy-wise.

Message.Msg: Great idea! Maybe we should think about buying some "Happy Sequester Day Poles" for the newly unemployed who lost their jobs. Then in celebration the democrats among them could gather around the "Happy Sequester Day Poles", light candles, and have the "Airing of Grievances" about Republicans and of course George Bush. After that, everyone could sit down for the traditional "Happy Sequester Day Dinner" where a union boss will pray for our "dear leader" and for all Republicans to get food poisoning. And finally after the "Happy Sequester Day Dinner", where the Republicans were forced to eat the traditional "Fetid Food for Republicans", there would be the "Happy Sequester Day Feats of Strength" where the democrats would berate and chastise the sick Republicans for being Republicans and for eating the "Fetid Food for Republicans". All in all, I think this kind of celebration could really catch on with all of those people who have lost their jobs, and are forced to live on food stamps because the Republicans didn't realize that the President and his party were only kidding when they came up with the idea of sequestration in the first place. I can see it now, with little Bob Woodward, barely able to stand under the "Happy Sequester Day Pole", while leaning on his crutch (because the Republicans kept him from getting proper medical care) and saying these words: "In your heart you know he is right." Happy Sequester Day everyone The Frogg

Get real guy, the so called $85 billion cut is really $44 billion, and because of baseline budgeting is being used the so called cut is actually a reduction in the amount of increase over the 2012 expenditures. So we get it, you and your "dear leader" want the government to confiscate more of the American people's earnings and property in order to make the government bigger, and some of us want the government to confiscate less of the American people's earning and property in order to make the government smaller. As a matter of fact it only makes me more relentless in my humble pursuit of the truth. Topic.Title: Will the American people care when they find out the truth about sequestration?

Message.Msg: For his first two years on office they had both the Senate and the House. He still controls the Senate, for all the good it has done. Obama and Harry have both been MIA for the past months. Harry has not allowed a budget to come up for vote for three years. He has offered no compromises to the current situation and he and his Fool On The Hill claim the other side won't compromise. When you make an offer, which they haven't, then refuse anything the other side suggests, it smacks heavily of evil planning to then say the other side won't compromise. A compromise means both side give a little to gain a lot. Obama and Harry won't budge on anything including performing their jobs. Obama didn't accept the offer to mitigate the spending cuts to places where Obama thought they were better accomplished because then any changes would have his name on them and he could be blamed for those decisions if they didn't work. That is why he does nothing but talk, agrees to nothing but his plans, and fails in his leadership; he wants to ensure that he has no skin in the game. He is basically a political coward.

Topic.Title: Another funny from "Organizing For Action"

Message.Msg: Obummer's (aka Obozo's) Accomplishments 1. All-time record annual average gas price: In 2012, the average cost of a gallon of gas eclipsed previous record by nine cents, bringing the annual average to $3.60. 2. All-time record food stamp participation: As of [November 2012], for the first time in American history, 47,710,324 individuals, about one out of seven people living in United States-now receive food stamps. 3. All-time high youth unemployment: In the last four years, average youth unemployment eclipsed the previous record rising to 17.5%-the highest ever in recorded U.S. history. 4. All-time high number of Americans no longer in the labor force: Never before in U.S. history have so many been sidelined from the workforce. Today, a record 88,921,000 Americans are no longer a part of the U.S. labor force. 8.5 million fewer jobs in the workforce than when he took over 5. All-time record number of Americans collecting disability: Medical advancements & technological innovations have increased life expectancy and made workplaces safer. Still, the number of Americans collecting Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) has skyrocketed in the last four years. Currently, a record 8,827,795 individuals collect a disability check averaging $1,130.34 a month. 6. All-time record number of Americans living in poverty: According to the U.S. Census Bureau, a record 46.2 million people in America are living in poverty, the highest number in the 53 years that the Census Bureau has collected the figure. 7. All-time record U.S. debt: The last four years have exploded the U.S. debt to levels never seen before in American history. Presently, the United States is $16,400,000,000,000 in debt. Bravo, Obummer, bravo indeed! PS. The penalty for destroying an egg of the American eagle is $250,000 + time in jail. The government pays for you to destroy the egg of a human being with our tax money.
